Title: Cove Point’s weekly LNG exports seen halved due to partial pipeline closure
Description: LNG exports from the Berkshire Hathaway-operated 5.25 mtpa Cove Point plant in Maryland are poised to halve this week against week-earlier levels, thanks to a drop in feed gas flows to the plant following the shutdown of a portion of the Columbia Gas transmission pipeline on Jul. 25.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Guangdong Energy seeks four LNG cargoes a year over two to five years
Description: Chinese utility Guangdong Energy has issued a tender to buy four LNG cargoes a year for delivery to Guangdong over a period of two to five years starting in January. The tender closes on Aug. 8.
Author: CK

Title: Panama Canal daily transit capacity limited to 32 ships from Jul. 30 as drought persists
Description: The Panama Canal Authority plans to allow only 32 ships to transit the canal daily from Jul. 30,  with the move aimed at reducing the possibility of additional draught restrictions in the coming weeks due to an extended dry season.
Author: CK
